benchmark_details.name: Fraud-R1
benchmark_details.overview: Fraud-R1 is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLMsâ€™ ability to defend against internet fraud and phishing in dynamic, real-world scenarios, featuring a multi-round evaluation pipeline.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of Fraud-R1 is to assess the robustness of LLMs against fraud and phishing inducements, with a focus on real-world applications.

data.source: 8,564 fraud cases sourced from phishing scams, fake job postings, social media, and news, categorized into 5 major fraud types.
data.annotation: Manually collected and categorized fraudulent cases.

methodology.calculation: DSR is calculated as the proportion of samples for which the model successfully identifies fraud in any of the conversation rounds.
methodology.interpretation: Higher DSR indicates better model performance in identifying and resisting fraudulent or phishing attempts.
methodology.validation: All models evaluated under both Helpful Assistant and Role-play settings for a comprehensive assessment.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark evaluates performance across different language groups and identifies disparities in performance between English and Chinese.
harm: Risk of misclassifying legitimate communications as fraud due to biases in training data.
